post.summary:
Discards connection information to all EMS systems known to the user. This will force the server to reload all configuration
            and other information from the server during the next connection.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

503.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests has been reached.

post.summary:
Discards connection information to the backing EMS system. This will force the server to reload all configuration
            and other information from the server during the next connection.
post.description:
Typically this is called when there have been modifications to user or group membership in groups in Active Dirctory. 
            In desktop applications, when someone has their group membership changed, that user can lock and unlock the machine, 
            which recreates the user token representing the rights for that user. In the case of a web server, there is no way to 
            manually refresh the cached user rights short of stopping and starting the application pool. 
            Instead, call this method to force the web server to refresh access rights based on group membership changes.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

503.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests has been reached.

post.summary: Informs the website that security has been modified on an EMS system and requests a refresh from Active Directory.
post.description:
Typically this is called when there have
            been modifications to user or group membership in groups in Active Dirctory. In desktop applications, when someone
            has their group membership changed, that user can lock and unlock the machine, which recreates the user token 
            representing the rights for that user. In the case of a web server, there is no way to manually refresh the cached
            user rights short of stopping and starting the application pool. 
            Instead, call this method to force the web server to refresh access rights based on group membership changes.

post.summary: Queries offsets and values in time-series data for a specified flight and analytic.
post.description:
This can be used to query for multiple analytics at the same time by providing more than one analytic ID in the query. Keep in mind that querying for many analytics might cause your request to take a longer period of time to complete.

Below are some guidelines to consider when using this API.

  • Use the size option to return a specified amount of interpolated samples.
  • Not specifying a size returns all data samples, but you can also use a range of start and end values to limit the amount of data returned. You can't use this option with the unsampledDataMode option.
  • Use the offsets option to return data for only a specified set of samples. If an analytic isn't sampled at the offset, its interpolated value is returned. You can't use this option with the unsampledDataMode option.
  • Use the offsetType option to return values only at sampled locations using the sampledValues type or at a specific sampling rate using the fixedRate type along with the samplingRate value. Since these options are more complex and can leave sample locations with no value (i.e. the analytic isn't sampled at that location) or DNE values where the sample does not exist you can use the offsetType in conjunction with the unsampledDataMode, the unsampledValue, and/or the doesNotExistValue options. These are explained in greater detail below.
  • If you use the unsampledDataMode option with offsetType you can set how unsampled data is treated with one of the following options:
    • leaveBlank Leaves any unsampled data locations as blank values. This is the default.
    • uniquePreviousSample leaves values blank except when there is a previous valid sampled value that was skipped over due to the sampling rate if it is unchanged. This can be used to circumvent the issue of possibly returning all blank values when the provided sampling rate doesn't match the analytic's sampling rate.
    • stairStep Any unsampled values are filled with the last known sampled value.
    • linearInterpolation This performs a linear interpolation on the data to calculate a value for unsampled locations.
    • parameterDefault Some analytics define their own default for how to treat unsampled data. This option uses that default setting.
    • previousSample leaves values blank except when there is a previous valid sampled value that was skipped over due to the sampling rate (regardless of change). This can be used to circumvent the issue of possibly returning all blank values when the provided sampling rate doesn't match the analytic's sampling rate or if the values are not changing.
  • Use the unsampledValue to provide your own value to be used for unsampled values. This only applies when using offsetType queries.
  • Use the doesNotExistValue to provide your own value for values that are DNE. This only applies when using offsetType queries.
  • Use the discretesAsStrings to specify whether the values of discrete parameters should be their string representations or their numeric value. This only applies when using offsetType queries.

post.summary:
Queries a database for information, composing the query with information provided in the specified 
            query structure.
post.description:
The advantage of this query route over async-query is its simplicity. This route executes a query and returns the results in a single API call. Due to memory and network resource limitations, this route cannot be used to fetch large result sets. The route limits the maximum number of result rows that can be returned for a single query. If you do not specify a "top" limit to the results and the number of rows queried exceeds the maximum allowed, the partial result boolean flag included in the response will be set to true. If you need to access larger result sets, use the async-query route instead.

Queries can contain reference to one or more fields and can include more complex querying operations including: filtering, grouping, and sorting (by value). These operations are specified by the query model you provide the API.

One thing to be aware of when creating a query and choosing the fields is that there are special fields for comment logs. These fields' results are represented as strings, but are more complex under the covers in that they represent a 1-to-many relationship. Thus the single string result is a concatenation of the many results. Also in order for this type of query to execute it must meet certain criteria or it will return a 400 Bad Request. First the comment log field must be associated with the entity type of the database being queried. For example if you are querying for the Data Quality Comment field which is a flight-based field the database has to be the FDW flight database. Second the query must include the primary key field(s) for the database that is being queried. The primary key field(s) can be found using the database-groups endpoint.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the system containing the EMS data.

parameters.name: databaseId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the EMS database to query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The information used to construct a query for which results are returned.

parameters.name: enableAnyDatabaseFields
parameters.description:
If true, the field identifiers in the query can come from any database,
            not just the provided database. For example, if you have a field identifier for the flight id from the flight database,
            but want to make a request to an event database, you could use that same field identifier.

400.description: If the specified query structure is invalid or incorrectly configured. May also be returned if the top value specified is greater than the maximum number of rows that can be returned.

503.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests has been reached.

post.summary:
Creates a query on a database using the provided query structure and returns an ID that can be used to
            fetch result data through other async-query routes.
post.description:
The advantage of the async-query routes over the basic query route is their ability to return very large result sets, split across many API calls. For queries with small result sets, you may prefer to use the basic query route, as it provides the simplicity of executing a query and returning the results in one call.

Use the GET v2/ems/{emsSystemId}/databases/{databaseId}/async-query/{queryId}/read/{start}/{end} route to read rows from the async-query result set.

Use the DELETE v2/ems/{emsSystemId}/databases/{databaseId}/async-query/{queryId} route to stop an async query.

Queries can contain reference to one or more fields and can include more complex querying operations including: filtering, grouping, and sorting (by value). These operations are specified by the query model you provide the API.

One thing to be aware of when creating a query and choosing the fields is that there are special fields for comment logs. These fields' results are represented as strings, but are more complex under-the-covers in that they represent a 1-to-many relationship. Thus the single string result is a concatenation of the many results. Also in order for this type of query to execute it must meet certain criteria or it will return a 400 Bad Request. First the comment log field must be associated with the entity type of the database being queried. For example if you are querying for the Data Quality Comment field which is a flight-based field the database has to be the FDW flight database. Second the query must include the primary key field(s) for the database that is being queried. The primary key field(s) can be found using the database-groups endpoint.

get.summary: Returns rows between (inclusive) the start and end indexes from the async query with the given ID.
get.description:
You can choose the number of rows returned by specifying an inclusive range of rows with the start and end 
            indexes. However, this route also limits the maximum number of result rows that can be reasonably returned 
            in a single call. If more values need to be read, simply make multiple calls to this route and use
            the "hasMoreRows" flag to determine if the returned rows are the last rows in the query's result set.
            You can ask if the query has finished before fetching rows, it is useful when having large queries to avoid timeouts.

parameters.description:

            than the flight's identified runway. This must be a valid runway Id for the flight's airport.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Admin.ApiClient.description: Represents an API client application that consumes REST services hosted in the website.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Admin.User.description: Represents a user account that can be used to access the website.

id.description: The unique integer identifier of the user.

username.description:
The Active Directory username of the user, typically in the form of "domain\user.name". If not in an 
            environment with multiple domains, the domain name is not needed.

lockoutPolicyEnabled.description:
Indicates whether the account lockout policy applies to this user, causing them to be locked out of the
            application for a configured amount of time after failed login attempts.

roles.description: The list of roles to which the user is a member.

tableauUsername.description:
The Tableau username to which this user is linked. This user name is only needed if different than the user 
            name.

lastLogin.description: A read-only value indicating the last time the user logged into the application.

lockoutEndDateUtc.description:
A read-only value indicating the time that the user will no longer be locked out. Null if the user is not 
            currently locked out.

accessFailedCount.description: A read-only value indicating the number of times the user failed to login.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Admin.Dashboard.description: Represents a message used to provide information to users about an action that took place in an API request.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Alert.Definition.description: Defines a type of alert that can occur for some asset type

id.description: The unique id of the definition

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the alert

description.description: A free-form description of what the alert represents

linkedType.description: The schema entity type that the alert applies to (such as Aircraft)

autoResetAfterDays.description:
When set to a value greater than 0, alerts in the Active state whose last change was
            recorded at least this many days ago will be automatically set back to Inactive

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Alert.SetDefiniti.description: Contains the information required to create/update an alert definition.

displayName.description: The human-readable name for the alert

description.description: A free-form description of what the alert represents

autoResetAfterDays.description:
When set to a value greater than 0, alerts in the Active state whose last change was
            recorded at least this many days ago will be automatically set back to Inactive

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Alert.GetActivity.description: Output type for getting the activity of an alert, and returned from a call to add alert trigger history.

recordedAt.description: The timestamp of when the activity record was recorded on the server.

triggerDate.description:
The timestamp of the data that triggered the alert activity (for instance, if the alert activity
            was triggered by analysis of a flight, the flight date could be considered the trigger date)

isActive.description: Specifies whether the alert is Active or Inactive.

stateChanged.description: Specifies whether the alert state changed from the previous activity to this activity.

sortKey.description: A sortable string which orders the alert activity in ascending real-world chronological order.

triggerAgent.description: Free-form string that identifies the agent which recorded the activity, such as a profile number.

triggerReferenceType.description:
Optional: caller-defined information which identifies what type of information
            is stored in TriggerReferenceValue. When returned from a call to set an alert's
            state, this is the value provided to that call. When returned from a call to get
            an alert's state, this is the value from the last time the alert actually changed
            state (from Active to Inactive or vice versa).

triggerReferenceValue.description:
Optional: a record number or other value which was associated with this alert
            state change. For example, this may be the record number of a flight whose
            data was the cause of the state change (maybe through an APM alert trigger).
            When returned from a call to set an alert's state, this is the value provided to
            that call. When returned from a call to get an alert's state, this is the value
            from the last time the alert actually changed state (from Active to Inactive or
            vice versa).

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Alert.AddActivity.description: Input data type for adding to the history of an alert for some entity (e.g. an aircraft)

triggerDate.description:
The timestamp of the data that triggered the alert activity (for instance, if the alert activity
            was triggered by analysis of a flight, the flight date could be considered the trigger date)

isActive.description: Specifies whether the alert was/became Active or Inactive at the given trigger date

sortKey.description: A sortable string which orders the alert activity in ascending real-world chronological order

triggerAgent.description:
Optional: caller-defined free-form string that identifies the agent which recorded the activity,
            such as a profile number.

triggerReferenceType.description:
Optional: caller-defined information which identifies what type of information
            is stored in TriggerReferenceValue

triggerReferenceValue.description:
Optional: a record number or other value which is associated with this alert
            state change. For example, this may be the record number of a flight whose
            data was the cause of the state change (maybe through an APM alert trigger).

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Query.description: Represents the options used to make up an analytic query.

select.description:
An array specifying the analytics to select and return in query results. Use null or an empty array to
            return only offset values

start.description:
The optional start offset in the data, in seconds from the start of the data. If not specified, the 
            beginning of the available data is used

end.description:
The optional end offset in the data, in seconds from the start of the data. If not specified, the 
            end of the available data is used

offsets.description:
The optional set of offsets to return in query results. Use as an alternative to specifying a range of 
            values using start and end

size.description: The optional limit that specifies the total number of offsets and values to return in query results

unsampledDataMode.description:
This determines how to treat data values for offsets that are not sampled. If left unset this defaults to 'leaveBlank'.
            This only applies when performing queries using "offsetType"

unsampledValue.description:
This optional parameter replaces any unsampled (blank) values with a constant value. This defaults to a null value.
            This only applies when performing queries using "offsetType"

doesNotExistValue.description:
This optional parameter replaces any values that come back as DNE (does not exist) with a constant value. This defaults to "DNE".
            This only applies when performing queries using "offsetType"

offsetType.description: This defines the way in which the offsets are determined. This is required if Offsets or Size has not been set

discretesAsStrings.description:
This optional parameter, when set to true, displays discrete values as their respective string values. This defaults to true.
            This only applies when performing queries using "offsetType"

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Analyt.description: Represents an individual analytic that can be selected in a query.

analyticId.description: The unique string identifier of the analytic to select in a query

alias.description: An optional, custom name to associate with the analytic in the query results

type.description: Determines the way to retrieve samples for an analytic query.

samplingRate.description: Offsets are calculated using this sampling rate when using 'FixedRate' sampling type.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.QueryR.description: Represents the time-series data result of an analytic query.

offsets.description: An array of query result offsets, each representing seconds from the start of the data

results.description:
An array of analytic result values for each of the analytics selected in the query containing values for
            each offset

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Analyt.description:
Represents the results of a query of an individual analytic, housing the values for the offsets contained
            in the related query result.

analyticId.description: The unique string identifier of the analytic queried

alias.description: The (optional) custom name of the analytic that produced these results

error.description:
Any error that may have occurred when retrieving or attempting to retrieve the values for the analytic.
            This field is only available if there is an error.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.Updat.description: The information for updating an analytic set group.

name.description:
The name of the analytic set group.
            This can be the existing name or a new name

parentGroupId.description: The groupId of the parent group for this analytic set group

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.Analy.description: The result of an updated group.

groupId.description: The group identifier of the updated group

location.description: The URI location of the updated group

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.Updat.description: Encapsulates the data for updating an existing analytic set.

description.description: An optional description of the AnalyticSet

items.description: An array of the analytics contained in the AnalyticSet

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.NewAn.description: A model that encapsulates the data for a single analytic in an analytic set.

chartIndex.description: The index of the chart that this analytic info belongs to, or null if no index specified

chartSize.description:
The size of the chart or null if not specified.
            Possible values: [Normal, Small]

analyticId.description: The analytic identifier that is represented by this analytic set item

customName.description: The custom name the user specified for the item, or null if not-specified

color.description: The color to use for the line in hexadecimal color specification "#RRGGBB", or null if no color specified

customRange.description: Optional override for the vertical scale for an analytic

customDigitsAfterDecimal.description: Optional override for the number of digits to display

lineWidth.description: Optional value from 1 to 5 for the width of the line

displaySampleMarker.description: Optional value specifying whether the parameter should display shapes to indicate the sampled values

sampleMarkerShape.description:
If set, describes the shape to use for the sampled values.
            Possible values: [Square, Circle, Triangle, InvertedTriangle, Cross, Star]

lineStyle.description:
If set, describes the line style to use when drawing.
            Possible values: [Dash, Dot, DashDot, DashDotDot, Solid]

parameterFilteringMode.description:
Whether parameter filtering mode should be enabled for this item or not.
            possible values: [Default, Enabled, Disabled]

interpolationMode.description:
The way in which the data should be interpolated.
            Possible values: [Default, StairStep, Continuous].

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.NewAn.description: Encapsulates the data for the creation of a new analytic set.

name.description: The name of the AnalyticSet

description.description: An optional description of the AnalyticSet

items.description: An array of the analytics contained in the AnalyticSet

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.AnalyticSet.Analy.description: Encapsulates the results of a successfully created analytic set.

name.description: The name of the AnalyticSet

groupId.description: The group identifier of the AnalyticSet

location.description: The full URL of the newly created AnalyticSet

description.description: An optional description of the AnalyticCollection

items.description: An array of the analytics contained in the AnalyticCollection

analyticId.description: The analytic identifier that is represented by this analytic collection item

customName.description: The custom name the user specified for the item, or null if not-specified

color.description: The color to use for the line in hexadecimal color specification "#RRGGBB", or null if no color specified

customRange.description: Optional override for the vertical scale for an analytic

customDigitsAfterDecimal.description: Optional override for the number of digits to display

lineWidth.description: Optional value from 1 to 5 for the width of the line

displaySampleMarker.description: Optional value specifying whether the parameter should display shapes to indicate the sampled values

sampleMarkerShape.description:
If set, describes the shape to use for the sampled values.
            Possible values: [Square, Circle, Triangle, InvertedTriangle, Cross, Star]

lineStyle.description:
If set, describes the line style to use when drawing.

parameterFilteringMode.description:
